USA", "logo": { "@type":"ImageObject", "url":"https://us.hola.com/build/front/usa/images/logo.png", "width": 196, "height": 60 } }, "keywords": ["Coronavirus"], "image": { "@type": "ImageObject", "representativeOfPage": true, "url": "/images/025b-0f0fa1dbe739-5edafa3dce0d-1000/horizontal-1150/homeschool-during-coronavirus.jpg", "width": 1150, "height": 690 } }

div.h1: 14 hilarious memes that show how parents are dealing with homeschool
div.h2: This is what happens when the living room becomes the classroom

div.p: We get it. A lot is happening during the coronavirus pandemic. Between social distancing, working from home, virtual happy hours, and toilet paper shortages, life as we know it has come to a halt. But that doesn’t mean we can’t have a good laugh while scrolling through the wonderful world of the internet. If anything, that’s what we need! With parents working from home and schools being closed until further notice, many have had to make adjustments to homeschool their children – and let’s just say, it’s been quite the experience for some!

However, parents are poking fun at their new lifestyles and sharing the laughs with the world wide web. Keep scrolling to see some of the funniest homeschooling memes circling the internet, and get ready to LOL. We could all use a good laugh, after all!

p.a: 10 of the funniest celebrity coronavirus memes

p.b: 1) Apparently, it’s all the parents’ faults.

div.blockquote: This is my my favorite meme of the homeschooling teacher ones I believe. pic.twitter.com/M5GL463Ma3— Daniel Ottalini (@DOttalini) March 20, 2020

p.b: 2) Yikes! Things took a sour turn after day three of quarantine.

div.blockquote: The forced working from home week has had great benefits such as more quality times with my kids... pic.twitter.com/Ml5sC4QKRh— François Tardif (@FtardifUofG) March 20, 2020

p.b: 3) But day four was something else! How did we get here?

p.a: Cardi B's daughter Kulture on list of top 5 most googled babies - see full list

div.p: A post shared by Dad Patrol (@teamdadpatrol) on Mar 20, 2020 at 11:06am PDT

p.b: 4) It looks like parents are getting creative nonetheless.

p.a: In case you missed this one... This dad is a GENIUS 😂😂😂 Tag parents who would use this. Via @upworthy

p.style: color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;

div.p: A post shared by Good News Movement (@goodnews_movement) on Mar 18, 2020 at 9:21pm PDT

p.b: 5) Why didn’t we think of this?

div.blockquote: Now here's a little tip all you parents #homeschooling little ones at the moment, do make time for an art class.👇🙌 pic.twitter.com/2uTA5QcPZR— Margaret O'Connell (@MargaretOC6) March 24, 2020

p.b: 6) If you think one kid is tough, imagine three under the age of ten.

div.blockquote:
8-year-old: “Mum, what did Anglo-Saxon children eat for breakfast?”
5-year-old: “Mum, how big is a cocoon for a butterfly? Do we have cocoons? Do you get cocoons in space? How far away is space?”
2-year-old (hiding under table): “I done a poo.”#homeschooling #homenurserying pic.twitter.com/iEEUdjTdof— The Unmumsy Mum (@TheUnmumsyMum) March 24, 2020

p.b: 7) Some may have to rely on the power of music.

p.a: The must-see Coronavirus memes that are keeping us positive

div.blockquote: New #HomeSchooling timetable from tomorrow morning onwards... pic.twitter.com/9Zc8JDHpyc— Simon Horrocks (@horrocks_simon) March 24, 2020

p.b: 8) You can’t underestimate elementary school math!

div.blockquote: If you had asked me what the hardest part of battling a global pandemic would be I would have never guessed, “teaching elementary school math.”— Simon Holland (@simoncholland) March 23, 2020

p.b: 9) The answer to this is simply: no can do.

p.a: We were volun-told today that we be virtual school home schooling starting march 30th 😳 thought maybe some others could use a laugh ;)

p.style: color:#c9c8cd; font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;

div.p: A post shared by Kendall Marie (@keepingupwiththreeboys) on Mar 17, 2020 at 3:31pm PDT

p.b: 10) When lunch (aka take a nap) time because your favorite time of the day!

div.blockquote: The struggle is real. #homeschooling #homeworking pic.twitter.com/yW6uSvCbbT— Dr Kirsty Fairclough (@DrKFairclough) March 26, 2020

p.b: 11) Math seems to be the hardest subject to teach kids.

div.blockquote: Day 1 with a 6th grader and 4th grader and I need google to help them with their Math 😰😬 #homeschooling pic.twitter.com/lWWLWQlGDX— sjb_xo_eb (@bolanos_lucero) March 16, 2020

p.b: 12) Working from home implies getting work done with 323,243 interruptions.

div.blockquote: #Homeschooling / #WorkFromHome Day 1 . Biggest takeaway so far, my son’s teacher needs a raise. #QuarantineLife pic.twitter.com/UHDliyEaBi— Lindsey C (@lilDnD) March 16, 2020

p.b: 13) Shonda Rhimes is beginning to understand the worth of educational workers.

div.blockquote: Been homeschooling a 6-year old and 8-year old for one hour and 11 minutes. Teachers deserve to make a billion dollars a year. Or a week.— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) March 16, 2020

p.b: 14) At least we can all laugh about it at the end of the day!
